TextBlock._LCLZText: Use the Mass Participation Factor to assess the percentage of the system mass that participates per direction for each mode.

Note that modes with a large effective mass participation typically have a stronger influence on the system response. The compact dialog displays the mass participation for the active mode. To display all modes, expand the dialog.
Use the Global Contacts command to automatically generate contact pairs.
Contact pairs are only generated between bodies, not between faces or edges.

Tips._LCLZText: Generate a Contact pair relationship between all Bodies in the Study. Use the Global Separation Contact option to ensure bodies can separate over time after initial contact. Turn off to default to Bonded.Use the Proximity Bonded Contact option to declare initial Bodies within a tolerance distance to be considered bonded and inseparable.

TextBlock._LCLZText: View the list of all contacts.
The list allows you to edit, and suppress contacts.

Tips._LCLZText: A table of all Contact pairs in the Study. Take actions on one or more Contacts, including Edit, Change Type, Suppress and Delete. Restore Defaults will revert to the Default table state.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Selects materials to use in the design process.
Select at least one material for your study. Outcomes are generated for each material that you select.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a material in the Library section and drag it to the In This Study section.

Description._LCLZText: You can select from one to seven materials for your study.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates multiple designs that meet your manufacturing, performance, and cost requirements.
